Reviews.Title: “Good location, horrible beds”
Reviews.Author: SD_Amit
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for a night in March and we booked a Quadruple room. The room did have four places for people to sleep, but only two of them were beds. One was a fold out cot and the other was a futon. The futon and the cot were very uncomfortable. At the time, Barcelona was having a hot spring, so the room was warm when we checked in. The staff informed us that the air conditioning was getting turning on that day, but it was not ready yet. Opening the windows helped cool the room off though. The only good part of the hotel was the excellent staff. They were friendly and attentive to our requests. The quadruple room sleeping arrangement though was not what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms but airless and too hot”
Reviews.Author: funkylittlefrog
Reviews.Content: Hotel Azul is situated in a fantastic location just off Plaza Espanya in Barcelona. The staff are very nice and friendly. The room is spacious and clean. There is a roof terrace which is very nice to relax on. The only wierd thing is that there are two sets of windows with the outer one locked with warning not to open it. Mentioning that the room was too hot at reception, we were given a handle to open the window, but still it shut under gravity and so the room was very airless and stuffy overnight.

Reviews.Title: “cheap price but in great location”
Reviews.Author: phoongy
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights in october. 2 adults + 3 kids fit in family room with double bed and sofa bed (same size as double bed). clean and spacious room. very simple. location close to many shops and restaurants. 5 minutes walk to plaza espanya. exceptionally nice staff, helpful with directions and info.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good value!”
Reviews.Author: Fioliriam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for two nights this summer with my fiancee, and had a great time. The room was large, clean and had a kitchenette as well as a separate living room. The staff was both friendly and helpful, and gave us great advice about getting around and practical tips on the city. We highly recommend this hotel, which although modest was very welcoming.

Reviews.Title: “even better than last year”
Reviews.Author: Rioja00
Reviews.Content: This year we got a huge room for 2 persons (room No. 55) with a separate living room and a bedroom with a closet. Two TV sets :-) Not that we watch much TV while in Spain... Daily cleaning and towel change. Small fridge with free water/fanta/coke. Breakfast still costs 8 Euro per person. If you want a hot breakfast (e.g. eggs with bacon) try a nearby restaurant Tapa Tapa at Plaza d'Espanya, at the new shopping mall - around 6 Euro including coffee or juice. If we go back to Barcelona next year we will again stay in Azul. It's worth it! And a new shopping mall has been opened at Plaza d'Espanya with cinema, numerous shops and places to have lunch or coffee. Open daily till 11pm.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel to see city”
Reviews.Author: dmath35489
Reviews.Content: it was a decent hotel. we had a quad. free drinks in fridge, full kitchen, 2person bedroom was good, sofabed was also good, but the 4th bed (a singlet) was terrible, 100 lb limit, or the wood falls apart. funny. so we managed in the other room. we took a taxi from the station because lot of luggage. the metro was 2 blocks away, great to travel after dropping luggage. free wifi but little slow. it was like an apartment, but they clean your room too! worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed it and went back for more”
Reviews.Author: rebeccafromoz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an a great location near Montjuic and the art museum. Espana Metro station and airport bus stop are very close by and supermarket and restaurants are a few doors up. Rooftop terrace was excellent with sunbeds, great views and very handy for a smoker. The first room i had was large and comfortable, featuring a kitchenette and fridge with free drinks which is unusually hospitable. Separate bedroom and free wifi. I did not notice any noise but when i went back for a second stay the room was smaller, noisier with no kitchen - this was the last room left in the hotel so obviously not the best one. Staff were helpful and welcoming. Am going back in June.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: paulbeever
Reviews.Content: A bit off the beaten track, but a great place to stay. Double room is more of a mini suite, fully equipped with fridge, hob, and kitchen sink, separate lounge and bedroom. Spotlessly clean, faultless, discreet, and very helpful staff. The only thing that stopped it getting 5 stars across the board is the location - it's on a noisy main road (the double glazing does mean you can still get a good nights sleep!) and there's not a great view. We thought it outstanding value for money - thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “good budget hotel -be prepared to wait for breakfast”
Reviews.Author: luptatum
Reviews.Content: Booked on line, staff were helpful, supplied a metro ticket for 10 trips. hotel 3 stops from las ramblas 5 minutes walk to the nearest metro station. Hotel next to busy rd but double glazing worked. Air con not working and it was a hot couple of nights. Had to wait for breakfast . small room not large enough and there was only one member of staff with too much todo. lot of food eaten and not replaced. caused an argument between me and my partner. otherwise room was clean, front of house staff were helpful.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rioja00
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the first floor just above the main street - no problems with sleeping, street noise blocked by the windows. Rooms are spacious, free wifi available, although I needed to struggle to get internet access in room No. 101 and I ended up sitting with my laptop near the elevators :-). Breakfast (additional price of 8 E) pretty good with a choice of ham, cheese and other stuff, incuding good coffee and cakes. Nothing hot though. Good location, with a 3 minutes' walk from the evening fountain show on Plaza d'Espanya and 2 stops from the main railway station. good location for sightseeing and only 3 stops from Old Town and Ramblas.

Reviews.Title: “Clean but awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatheG
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Barcelona and although we only stayed one night I was not impressed with the Hotel Azul. Walls paper thin beds totally uncomfortable and forget about getting a wake up call. I asked for one at 4am due to an early flight back to the US, they forgot to call us luckily I had woken up early anyway. Only good thing was the free WIFI. Location not at all close to Sants station close to Espanya.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 3 star, average location”
Reviews.Author: HuskerAV8R
Reviews.Content: The Azul is easy to find, as it is lit up at night in bright blue, as the name implies. Our room was quite large for Europe (apprx. 350 sq feet). It had a separate room for the parents, with TV, safe, and closet; the main room had a pull out sofa sleeper and separate single bed. The bathroom was spacious. The main room had a refrigerator and TV, although the main TV satellite channels didn't work. The one in the bedroom worked fine. Go figure. The staff were pleasant and helpful with typical tourist questions. The best feature about the Azul was the value for a 3 star in Barcelona. It was E125 per night for the quad, and we added on a third night that was down to E99 due to the rooms being widely available (March - off season). It is located on a fairly noisy main street. We had to open the windows in the evening to cool them down since they hadn't yet turned on the air conditioning. So it was loud while the windows were open. But it cooled off quickly and the noise wasn't too bad with them shut for the night. There are several bar/restaurants nearby, and a combination grocery store-fresh meat market (fish, beef, chicken, flowers, wines) is located 2 blocks behind and 3 blocks south of the hotel. The Metro is 1/4 mile up the boulevard. You can also get a bus at the Metro entrance that will go anywhere in Barcelona. Overall it is a good 3 star hotel, although it isn't centrally located and lacks the inherent benefit of being right where the A)action or B)old Barcelona is. While it only takes 5 minutes and 2 stops to get down to Las Ramblas, you feel like you could have found something else had you kept looking. I would go back to the Azul but only if I couldn't find something right by Las Ramblas first.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: abc_def062
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2008. I wouldn't normally stay in a hotel of this quality but I left it very late to book so it was the cheapest get. I paid €100 per night for a very large suite, which was very comfortable and quite good value, but probably more luxury than I needed. The location is only ok for two reasons: one is it's not in the very centre of the city, so you end up having to travel by metro or taxi more than if you were in the centre; two the street the hotel is on is very busy and quite noisy (I got woken up by traffic and had to wear earplugs but I am quite a light sleeper). There is a really nice cafe nearby at Placa Espanya with a very friendly Argentine waitress and good coffee (hard to find in Spain!). The room itself was beautiful and very modern comfortable. The staff were excellent, helpful and friendly. One thing to watch out for are the badly designed windows - I nearly fell out trying to open mine (seriously!). There's a notice beside the window recommending not to open it, so I guess I'm not the first guest who had trouble with it. Not so nice when you're on the 6th floor. :-) Certainly nothing wrong with this hotel - apart from the location. But probably a bit fancier than my needs, so I probably wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Wildiris117
Reviews.Content: We booked a triple room, expecting two beds and a cot in a single room. We were pleasantly surprised to find a 2 room suite with a full kitchenette, dining area, and a large bathroom. The rooms were very clean and nicely furnished. Staff was friendly, helpful, and multilingual. The location is great - less than a 5 minute walk to a centrally located metro station. Couldn't have asked for a better hotel in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “cant recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: fishoutofwater78
Reviews.Content: a great hotel, only complaint i'd have is that some of the front rooms are subject to street noise, but it was only ever a minor irritation. staff were excellent, very friendly and accomodating. their apartment rooms were very comfortable, and extremely reasonable for what you get. great location too, handy for the metro and right beside montjuic, which is an absolute must-see. also the surrounding neighbourhoods are quiet and pleasant, very traditional. two thumbs up! p.s this also deserves a mention, out of 4 hotels i stayed in in barcelona, this hotel was the only one who's internet connection was both free (in other places the standard seems to be 22euro per 24h), and worked properly.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Azul Barcelona
HotelInfo.Address: Gran via de las Cortes Catalanas 327, 08014 Barcelona, Spain (Formerly Access)
